meanings.definition: A person or thing that is not equal to another in status or ability.
meanings.sent1: In the race, the winner and the loser are nonequals.
meanings.sent2: The teacher and the student are nonequals in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat and the dog are nonequals when it comes to climbing trees.
meanings.sent4: The sun and the moon are nonequals in the sky, each with its own beauty.
meanings.sent5: The king and the beggar are nonequals in their social standing.

meanings.definition: To be unequal or dissimilar to something else.
meanings.sent1: Her skills nonequals those of her sister in playing the piano.
meanings.sent2: The taste of the two dishes nonequals each other.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to dance nonequals his effort to sing.
meanings.sent4: The speed of the tortoise nonequals that of the hare in the race.
meanings.sent5: The size of the small flower nonequals the grandeur of the mighty tree.
